description: A legendary island that only surfaces from the ocean once every thousand years, serving as the ancient nesting and rebirth grounds for the sennenryu dragons. The island contains massive fossilized remains of ancient dragons.

keyEvents.title: Lost Island Resurfaces from Ocean
keyEvents.description: Triggered by Ryu's final roar calling out to the other sennenryu, the Lost Island emerges from beneath the sea for the first time in a thousand years, revealing the dragons' ancient nesting grounds.
keyEvents.significance: The climactic moment of the Warship Island arc, fulfilling Ryu's lifelong dream and revealing the truth about the sennenryu migration cycle. The island's emergence validates the legends and provides closure to the arc.

keyEvents.title: Truth About Lost Island's Nature Revealed
keyEvents.description: Nami deduces that the Lost Island is called 'Lost' not because it disappeared, but because it only surfaces once every thousand years during the sennenryu migration cycle.
keyEvents.significance: Explains the mystery of the island and the sennenryu species, providing scientific reasoning behind the legends.

keyEvents.title: Discovery of Dragon Fossils and Dragonite
keyEvents.description: The Lost Island is revealed to contain massive fossilized remains of ancient dragons - this is the true nature of the legendary 'Dragonite' that Nelson and Eric sought.
keyEvents.significance: Debunks the myth of Dragonite as an immortality elixir, showing it's simply fossilized dragon bones. Demonstrates how legends can be misinterpreted through the passage of time.

keyEvents.title: Ryu's Death on Lost Island
keyEvents.description: The ancient dragon Ryu dies peacefully on the Lost Island after reaching his lifelong destination.
keyEvents.significance: Fulfills Ryu's dream and provides the emotional climax of the arc on this sacred ground.

keyEvents.title: Dragon Egg Hatches on Lost Island
keyEvents.description: A dragon egg hatches on the Lost Island, revealing a baby sennenryu (implied to be Ryu reborn), demonstrating the island's role as a place of death and rebirth.
keyEvents.significance: Confirms the Lost Island's sacred purpose as a place where sennenryu complete their life cycle and are reborn.

statusHistory.reason: Island was underwater between thousand-year surfacing cycles
Island surfaced during sennenryu migration in episode 60

description: The ocean waters surrounding Warship Island where the Straw Hat Pirates battled Nelson Royal's Marine fleet. This is where the Lost Island emerged from beneath the sea.

keyEvents.title: Battle with Nelson's Marines
keyEvents.description: Luffy and the crew continue their battle against Nelson's Marine fleet in the waters around Warship Island.
keyEvents.significance: The location where the final confrontation of the arc takes place.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Destroys Nelson's Flagship
keyEvents.description: Luffy splits Nelson's Marine flagship in half with his Gum-Gum Battle-Axe in these waters.
keyEvents.significance: The decisive battle that ends Nelson's threat occurs in this location.

keyEvents.title: Lost Island Emerges from Waters
keyEvents.description: The Lost Island resurfaces from beneath these waters for the first time in a thousand years.
keyEvents.significance: Transforms the battlefield into the site of the arc's miraculous conclusion.

statusHistory.reason: Location of naval battles during Warship Island arc
